Dylan_Schneider:
{{short description|American singer-songwriter}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Dylan Schneider | caption = | image_size = | birth_name = | birth_place = [[Terre Haute, Indiana|Terre Haute]], [[Indiana]], United States | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1999|10|09}} | origin = | instrument = | genre = {{hlist|[[Country music|Country]]|[[country pop]]}} | occupation = Singer-songwriter | years_active = 2016–present | label = {{hlist|[[Interscope Records|Interscope]]|Round Here}} [[BBR Music Group]]{{cite web | url=https://musicrow.com/2021/07/dylan-schneider-signs-with-bbr-music-group/ | title=Dylan Schneider Signs with BBR Music Group | date=21 July 2021 }} | associated_acts = | website = {{official website|http://dylanschneidermusic.com/}} }} '''Dylan Schneider''' (born October 9, 1999) is an American [[country music]] singer and songwriter. He self-released his debut [[extended play]], ''Wannabe'' in August 2016. Labelled "Country Music's Next Rising Star" by [[Billboard (magazine)|''Billboard'']], Schneider has landed two EPs in the Top 20 of the magazine's [[Heatseekers Albums]] chart in under a year without a label to support them.{{cite magazine |last1=Dauphin |first1=Chuck |title=Dylan Schneider is Country Music's Next Rising Star|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/country/7678112/dylan-schneider-interview-17-you-heard-wrong-video|accessdate=April 25, 2017|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date=February 6, 2017}} In the following years, Schneider released a series of EPs, secured a publishing deal, and toured with artists such as [[Florida Georgia Line]] and [[Morgan Wallen]]. Schneider's achievements include two [[Recording Industry Association of America|RIAA]]-certified Gold records and a Top 5 hit as a songwriter with [[Dustin Lynch]]’s “[[Momma's House|Momma’s House]].” ==Career== Schneider was a fan of [[pop music|pop]] and [[hip hop music|hip hop]] music as a child, but later became attracted to the storytelling aspect of country music and began singing at the age of 14.{{cite news|last1=Deming|first1=Mark|title=Dylan Schneider {{!}} Biography & History|url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/dylan-schneider-mn0003562739/biography|accessdate=April 25, 2017|work=[[AllMusic]]|publisher=[[All Media Network]]}} After meeting [[Brett Eldredge]] at a concert in the singer's hometown ([[Paris, Illinois]]), Schneider was invited onstage by Eldredge to perform a song during the latter's performance in Terre Haute. He then began writing and performing songs both around [[Indiana]] and in [[Nashville]], [[Tennessee]]. Between 2014 and 2016, Schneider posted a number of videos to [[YouTube]] of him performing [[cover version]]s of popular country songs, which earned him attention online. The first video was posted on May 18, 2014.{{cite web|author1=DylanSchneiderMusic|title=Bottoms Up by Brantley Gilbert Cover - Dylan Schneider|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_OElx8udHoU|website=[[YouTube]]|publisher=[[Google]]|accessdate=April 25, 2017|format=video|date=May 18, 2014}} Schneider released his debut EP, ''Wannabe'', on August 19, 2016.{{cite web|title=Amazon.com: Wannabe - EP: Dylan Schneider: MP3 Downloads|url=https://www.amazon.com/Wannabe-EP-Dylan-Schneider/dp/B01KE21RZU|website=[[Amazon Music]]|accessdate=April 25, 2017}} His second EP, ''17'', was released the day after Schneider's seventeenth birthday and reached number 37 on the [[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] [[Top Country Albums]] chart. In February 2017, Schneider released his first radio single, "You Heard Wrong".{{cite news|last1=Horton|first1=Carrie|title=Who Is Dylan Schneider? 5 Things You Need to Know|url=http://theboot.com/who-is-dylan-schneider/|accessdate=April 25, 2017|work=The Boot|publisher=[[Townsquare Media]]|date=February 13, 2017}} He released his third EP, ''Spotlight's on You'', on April 14, 2017.{{cite web|title=Amazon.com: Spotlight's on You - EP: Dylan Schneider: MP3 Downloads |url=https://www.amazon.com/dp/B06Y3LD31F|website=[[Amazon Music]]|accessdate=April 25, 2017}} The record sold enough copies propelling the EP into the Top 10 of the [[Heatseekers Albums]] chart. Schneider released his fourth EP, ''Whole Town Talk'', in August 2019. The EP was released by [[Interscope Records]] through a partnership with Round Here Records; an independent label founded by [[Tyler Hubbard]] and [[Brian Kelley (musician)|Brian Kelley]] of the [[Florida Georgia Line]] who also co-wrote several of the new tracks. It was also announced Schneider would join [[Florida Georgia Line]] for select dates of their [[Can't Say I Ain't Country Tour|Can’t Say I Ain’t Country Tour]] alongside [[Dan + Shay]], [[Morgan Wallen]], and [[Canaan Smith]].{{Cite web|url=https://www.soundslikenashville.com/news/dylan-schneider-whole-town-talk-ep-florida-georgia-line/|title=DYLAN SCHNEIDER DROPS 'WHOLE TOWN TALK' EP WITH SUPPORT FROM FLORIDA GEORGIA LINE'S ROUND HERE RECORDS|last=Laffer|first=Lauren|website=Sounds Like Nashville|date=23 August 2019 |language=en|access-date=2019-08-23}} On July 21, 2021, Schneider signed with [[BBR Music Group]].{{cite web | url=https://musicrow.com/2021/07/dylan-schneider-signs-with-bbr-music-group/ | title=Dylan Schneider Signs with BBR Music Group | date=21 July 2021 }} With over 2 million [https://www.instagram.com/dylanschneidermusic/?hl=en social media followers], Schneider experienced a surge in popularity, gaining more than 500,000 followers within a few months. His music career has garnered over 388 million on-demand streams. As a songwriter, Schneider achieved a Top 5 hit with [[Dustin Lynch]]’s “[[Momma's House|Momma’s House]]"; He also holds two RIAA-certified Gold records, underscoring his achievements in the industry. In 2023, Schneider was recognized as the "[https://musicrow.com/2023/12/musicrow-reveals-next-big-thing-artists-class-of-2024/ Next Big Thing]" by [[MusicRow]], highlighting his emergence in the country music scene. Additionally, he was named a "Breakthrough Artist to Watch" by [[Amazon Music]] and an "Artist to Watch" by [[Pandora (service)|Pandora]]. In September of 2024, Schneider will embark on his headlining "Bad Decisions" Tour, featuring [https://www.marynntaylormusic.com MaRynn Taylor]. This tour follows his appearances on several tours, including [[Kane Brown]]’s "In the Air" Tour, [[Luke Bryan]]’s "Mind of a Country Boy" Tour, and [[Mitchell Tenpenny]]’s "Woke Up In A Dream" Tour. The "Bad Decisions" Tour is set to kick off in Vancouver, BC, on September 30, 2024. ==Discography== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |+ List of extended plays, with selected details, chart positions, and sales ! scope="col" style="width:15em;"| Title ! scope="col" style="width:10em;" | Release Date ! scope="col" style="width:10em;" | Label |- ! scope="row"| ''Wannabe - EP'' | August 19, 2016 | rowspan="3"| Dylan Schneider |- ! scope="row"| ''17 - EP'' | October 9, 2016 |- ! scope="row"| ''Spotlight's On You - EP'' | April 14, 2017 |- ! scope="row"| ''Whole Town Talk - EP'' {{cite web |url=https://www.soundslikenashville.com/news/dylan-schneider-whole-town-talk-ep-florida-georgia-line/ |title=Dylan Schneider Drops 'Whole Town Talk' EP With Support From Florida Georgia Line's Round Here Records |first=Lauren|last= Laffer|date= August 23, 2019|work=Sounds Like Nashville}} | August 23, 2019 | [[Interscope Records]] |- ! scope="row"| ''College Town - EP'' | March 18, 2022 | rowspan="2" | [[BBR Music Group]] |- ! scope="row"| ''Ain't Missin' You - Single'' | September 16, 2022 |- |''Bad Decisions - EP'' |April 26, 2024 |[[BBR Music Group]] |} ===Radio Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |+ List of radio singles, with release year, peak chart position, and certification ! scope="col" rowspan="2" style="width:15em;"| Title ! scope="col" rowspan="2" style="width:4em;" | Year ! scope="col" colspan="1" style="width:6em;" | Peak Chart Position ! rowspan="2" |[[List of music recording certifications|Certifications]] |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! style="width:6em;" | [[Hot Country Songs|US
